alert.note: Alert for Outagamie; Waupaca; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 10:07AM CDT until April 24 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan...Wisconsin... Menominee River near Vulcan affecting Menominee, Marinette and Dickinson Counties. Menominee River near Niagara affecting Menominee, Florence, Marinette and Dickinson Counties. Pine River near Florence affecting Florence County. Menominee River near Koss affecting Menominee and Marinette Counties. Menominee River near Menominee River at White Rapids Dam affecting Menominee and Marinette Counties. Brule River near Commonwealth affecting Forest, Florence, Iron and Dickinson Counties. Menominee River near Florence affecting Florence, Iron and Dickinson Counties. Peshtigo River near Porterfield affecting Marinette County. Peshtigo River below Caldron Falls Dam affecting Marinette County. Upper Wolf River near Shawano affecting Shawano County. Wolf River at New London affecting Winnebago, Waupaca and Outagamie Counties. Wolf River near Shiocton affecting Waupaca, Outagamie and Shawano Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan...Wisconsin... Menominee River near McAllister affecting Menominee and Marinette Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Pike River near Amberg affecting Marinette County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Menominee River...including Florence, Vulcan, Niagara, Menominee River at White Rapids Dam, Koss, McAllister...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Lower Wolf River...including Shiocton, New London...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wolf River at New London. * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Up to a foot of water is surrounding structures along West River Drive in Fremont. Several inches of floodwater begins to cover portions of Burton Road near Pheifer Park. Water is approaching portions of West Wolf Avenue near New London. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM CDT Tuesday was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Monday morning and continue falling to 8.7 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.4 feet on 04/03/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning.
